snippet: St. George’s University Medical School will offer $11 million in scholarships to New Yorkers in return for the students’ promise to work in New York City hospitals.
abstract: St George’s University Medical School on the Caribbean Island of Grenada will offer $11 million in scholarships to New Yorkers in return for the students’ promise to work in New York City hospitals; deal settles long-standing complaint that the school, by paying to have its students trained in the city's public hospitals, had turned what was meant to be an academic relationship into a fiscal one.
lead_paragraph: St. George’s University Medical School will offer $11 million in scholarships to New Yorkers in return for the students’ promise to work in New York City hospitals.

headline.seo: City Hospitals Reach Scholarship Deal With St. George’s University Medical School
headline.main: City Hospitals Reach $11 Million Scholarship Deal With Medical School in Grenada
headline.print_headline: City Hospitals Reach $11 Million Scholarship Deal With Medical School in Grenada
